judgment_text:
CWP No.9397 of 2007
IN THE HIGH COURT OF PUNJAB AND HARYANA CHANDIGARH
CWP No.9397 of 2007
Date of decision: 3.7.2007
Sher Singh and another 
...Petitioners
vs.
State of Punjab and others 
....Respondents
CORAM: HON'BLE MR. JUSTICE ADARSH KUMAR GOEL
 HON'BLE MR. JUSTICE AJAI LAMBA
Present: Mr. VK Sandhir, Advocate, for the petitioners.
 Mr. Har Simran Singh Sethi, Advocate for Caveators.
JUDGMENT:
This petition challenges order dated 25.5.2007, Annexure P.1
cancelling order of posting of the petitioners to the Municipal Town
Planning Wing as Building Inspectors.
Case of the petitioners is that in the Building Department of
Municipal Corporation, Amritsar, there are only seven Building Inspectors
against twenty vacancies and, therefore, the petitioners were posted against
the said vacant posts on 11.4.2007. Respondent Nos. 4 to 9 challenged the
posting of the petitioners by filing a writ petition in this Court, which was
disposed of vide order dated 23.4.2007 by directing that decision be taken
on legal notice of the said respondents. Accordingly, order Annexure P.1
has been passed cancelling order of posting of the petitioners in the Town
Planning Wing. 
CWP No.9397 of 2007
A perusal of order Anenxure P.1 shows that the Principal
Secretary to the Government of Punjab has taken into account service rules
laying down the qualification for Inspectors which the petitioners did not
possess. In the report Annexure P.7 submitted by the Commissioner,
Municipal Corporation, to the Government, it has been stated that the
services of the petitioners became surplus after abolition of octroi in which
department, the petitioners were working and there was scarcity of staff in
the Town Planning department.
In the writ petition, finding recorded in the impugned order
Anenxure P.1 that the petitioners were not technically qualified under the
rules, has not been disputed. 
Contention raised is that the petitioners were not getting any
extra monetary benefit by working in the said department and no loss was
caused to the private respondents and that the private respondents did not
fulfil the qualifications.
The petitioners cannot claim any vested right to be posted on
any particular post, particularly in absence of qualification, even if there
may be shortage of staff in a particular department. The impugned order
cancelling posting of the petitioners in the department of Town Planning
cannot be held to be illegal or in violation of any law.
No interference is, thus, called for with the impugned order.
The writ petition is dismissed. 
(Adarsh Kumar Goel)
 Judge 
July 3, 2007
 (Ajai Lamba)
